html.body:
It is possible to mirror the FreeBSD web pages www.FreeBSD.org.
This can be done using a program called csup.
csup is a software package in the base system for distributing and updating collections of files across a network.
Running csup
If you keep your mirrored FreeBSD web pages in the directory /usr/FreeBSD-mirror and are owned by the user `fred', then run the following command as user `fred':
$ csup supfile-www
The file supfile-www contain:
*default host=cvsup.FreeBSD.org *default prefix=/usr/FreeBSD-mirror *default base=/usr/local/etc/cvsup www release="current" delete use-rel-suffix compress
This will mirror the FreeBSD web pages into /usr/FreeBSD-mirror. You can install this into fred's crontab, so that it runs once a day.
